intro: Phylloschoenus supinus, commonly known as the prostrate broadleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, flat leaves that grow close to the ground, forming a dense mat. It typically thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Phylloschoenus supinus plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
